### TSPS Integrated National Training Platform

#### Contract Identification and Status

* **Contract Reference**: CB-468-96447548
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Solicitation Number**: 30004724
* **Publication Date**: September 29, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: October 16, 2023, at 14:00:00
* **Contract Status**: Expired

#### Contract Description

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires one senior Business Architect to establish a new technology platform to evaluate the effectiveness of its training investment and identify necessary adjustments to meet evolving needs. The Integrated National Training Platform (INTP) will enable the CCG to make informed training strategies, assess coverage, and adjust plans accordingly.

#### Key Contract Details

* **Duration**: From contract award to April 12, 2024, inclusive, with an irrevocable option to extend for one additional year under the same conditions.
* **Scope**: The CCG aims to create an INTP that will help seagoing employees attain the necessary skills to operate new vessels and support shore-based employees in better servicing their seagoing counterparts.
* **Trade Agreements**: This contract is subject to various free trade agreements, including the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

#### Supplier Eligibility

The contract is open to Supply Arrangement (SA) holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for the Business Architect category. Suppliers interested in participating must update their supplier profile and obtain proof of qualification before requesting an invitation.

#### Contact Information

* **Name**: Manon Paulin
* **Email**: [Manon.Paulin@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:Manon.Paulin@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
* **Phone**: (438) 468-3247

#### Important Notes

* The Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Method of Supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles. Suppliers interested in becoming qualified SA holders can contact SPTS.TSPS@TPSGC-PWGSC.GC.CA for more information.
* The contract proposal must be submitted in accordance with the solicitation documentation, which is available on request.
